dict.string: on run argv #@osa-lang:AppleScript #Roam Reuse 1.0 # # #current window being scanned set dbname to (system attribute "DBName") if (dbname is "") then display dialog "Please set DBName in workflow environment variables" return end if set windowIndex to 1 #current tab being scanned set tabIndex to 0 set lastTargetSearchString to "" #list of list of tab urls from all windows set allWindowsTabURLList to "" #list of list of tab titles from all windows set allWindowsTabTitlesList to "" #list of all windows, chrome first, then safari global allWindowsList, tabIndex, windowIndex set allWindowsList to "" #number of chrome windows in list above set chromeWindowCount to 0 global dbname, block set myurl to item 1 of argv #log "Time since last run in seconds:" & timeSinceLastRun #search chrome, then safari tabs for a string and activate it #windowIndex (current windows being searched) #tabIndex (how far through current window we are) # Inputs: set searchString to "roamresearch.com" set direction to "forward" set lastTargetSearchString to searchString log "Fetching titles from chrome" tell application "Google Chrome" #store windows so we keep the same order #if we don't store them the windows get out of order when we being stuff to front set allWindowsList to windows set allWindowsTabURLList to URL of tabs of every window set allWindowsTabTitlesList to title of tabs of every window end tell set chromeWindowCount to length of allWindowsList log "Fetching titles from safari" tell application "Safari" #store windows so we keep the same order #if we don't store them the windows get out of order when we being stuff to front set allWindowsList to allWindowsList & windows set allWindowsTabURLList to allWindowsTabURLList & (URL of tabs of every window) set allWindowsTabTitlesList to allWindowsTabTitlesList & (name of tabs of every window) end tell set windowIndex to 1 set tabIndex to 0 #log "tabIndex start: " & tabIndex #TODO do we need this? set found to false log "Total windows: " & length of allWindowsList log "Chrome windows: " & chromeWindowCount #stop looping when we get back to where we started, to handle cast where no tabs found set startWindowIndex to windowIndex if direction = "forward" then set tabIndex to tabIndex + 1 else set tabIndex to tabIndex - 1 end if set windowsSearched to 0 #iterate through all windows repeat while windowIndex ≤ length of allWindowsTabURLList and windowIndex > 0 #log "WindowIndex: " & windowIndex #log "tabIndex: " & tabIndex set thisWindowsTabsURLs to item windowIndex of allWindowsTabURLList set thisWindowsTabsTitles to item windowIndex of allWindowsTabTitlesList #log thisWindowsTabsURLs #iterate through all tabs in each window repeat while tabIndex ≤ length of thisWindowsTabsURLs and tabIndex > 0 #log "tabIndex : " & tabIndex set TabURL to item tabIndex of thisWindowsTabsURLs set Tabtitle to item tabIndex of thisWindowsTabsTitles if ((TabURL as text) contains searchString) or (Tabtitle contains searchString) then #chrome windows are first in array if windowIndex ≤ chromeWindowCount then tell application "Google Chrome" activate set w to item windowIndex of allWindowsList set index of w to 1 tell w to set active tab index to tabIndex # log myurl #set myurl to "https://roamresearch.com/#/app/" & dbname & "/page/" & arg tell w to set URL of active tab to myurl end tell #this delay seems to be needed to remove timing voodo delay 0.1 tell application "System Events" tell application process "Google Chrome" tell window 1 perform action "AXRaise" end tell end tell end tell else tell application "Safari" activate set w to item windowIndex of allWindowsList set index of w to 1 tell w to set current tab to tab tabIndex set URL of document 1 to myurl end tell #this delay seems to be needed to remove timing voodo delay 0.1 tell application "System Events" tell application process "Safari" tell window 1 perform action "AXRaise" end tell end tell end tell end if set found to true exit repeat end if #TODO Backward if (direction = "forward") then set tabIndex to tabIndex + 1 else set tabIndex to tabIndex - 1 end if end repeat if found then exit repeat if (direction = "forward") then set tabIndex to 1 set windowIndex to windowIndex + 1 if windowIndex > length of allWindowsTabURLList then set windowIndex to 1 end if else set windowIndex to windowIndex - 1 if windowIndex < 1 then set windowIndex to length of allWindowsTabURLList end if set tabIndex to length of item windowIndex of allWindowsTabURLList end if set windowsSearched to windowsSearched + 1 if windowsSearched > length of allWindowsList then exit repeat end if end repeat if not found then log "not found" end if return found end run script GetTick --> for more precise timer calculations use framework "Foundation" on Now() return (current application's NSDate's timeIntervalSinceReferenceDate) as real end Now end script

#@osa-lang:AppleScript #Roam Reuse 1.0 # # #current window being scanned set windowIndex to 1 #current tab being scanned set tabIndex to 0 #list of list of tab urls from all windows set allWindowsTabURLList to "" #list of list of tab titles from all windows set allWindowsTabTitlesList to "" #list of all windows, chrome first, then safari global allWindowsList, tabIndex, windowIndex set allWindowsList to "" #set kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE" #global dbName, block #tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" # set block to getvariable "local_roam_block" instance kmInst # set dbName to getvariable "local_roam_dbName" instance kmInst #end tell #search chrome, then safari tabs for a string and activate it #windowIndex (current windows being searched) #tabIndex (how far through current window we are) # Inputs: set searchString to "roamresearch.com" set lastTargetSearchString to searchString log "Fetching titles from safari" tell application "Safari" #store windows so we keep the same order #if we don't store them the windows get out of order when we being stuff to front set allWindowsList to windows set allWindowsTabURLList to (URL of tabs of every window) set allWindowsTabTitlesList to (name of tabs of every window) end tell set windowIndex to 1 set tabIndex to 0 #log "tabIndex start: " & tabIndex #TODO do we need this? set found to false #stop looping when we get back to where we started, to handle cast where no tabs found set startWindowIndex to windowIndex set tabIndex to tabIndex + 1 set windowsSearched to 0 #iterate through all windows repeat while windowIndex ≤ length of allWindowsTabURLList and windowIndex > 0 #log "WindowIndex: " & windowIndex #log "tabIndex: " & tabIndex set thisWindowsTabsURLs to item windowIndex of allWindowsTabURLList set thisWindowsTabsTitles to item windowIndex of allWindowsTabTitlesList #log thisWindowsTabsURLs #iterate through all tabs in each window repeat while tabIndex ≤ length of thisWindowsTabsURLs and tabIndex > 0 #log "tabIndex : " & tabIndex set TabURL to item tabIndex of thisWindowsTabsURLs set Tabtitle to item tabIndex of thisWindowsTabsTitles if ((TabURL as text) contains searchString) or (Tabtitle contains searchString) then return activateSarariTab() set found to true exit repeat end if #TODO Backward set tabIndex to tabIndex + 1 end repeat if found then exit repeat set tabIndex to 1 set windowIndex to windowIndex + 1 if windowIndex > length of allWindowsTabURLList then set windowIndex to 1 end if set windowsSearched to windowsSearched + 1 if windowsSearched > length of allWindowsList then exit repeat end if end repeat if not found then log "not found" end if # delay 0.1 #end repeat #beep return found on activateSarariTab() log "Activating Safari windowIndex: " & windowIndex & " tabindex:" & tabIndex tell application "Safari" set w to item windowIndex of allWindowsList set index of w to 1 tell w to set current tab to tab tabIndex set response to (do JavaScript "JSON.stringify({items:window.roamAlphaAPI.q('[:find ?e :where [?e :node/title]]').map(n=>{let o=window.roamAlphaAPI.pull('[*]', n[0]);return {title:o[':node/title'],uid:o[':block/uid'],arg:o[':block/uid']}})});" in document 1) end tell return response #this delay seems to be needed to remove timing voodo #tell application "System Events" # tell application process "Safari" # tell window 1 # perform action "AXRaise" # end tell # end tell #end tell end activateSarariTab

on run argv #@osa-lang:AppleScript #Roam Reuse 1.0 # # #current window being scanned set dbname to (system attribute "DBName") if (dbname is "") then display dialog "Please set DBName in workflow environment variables" return end if set windowIndex to 1 #current tab being scanned set tabIndex to 0 set lastTargetSearchString to "" #list of list of tab urls from all windows set allWindowsTabURLList to "" #list of list of tab titles from all windows set allWindowsTabTitlesList to "" #list of all windows, chrome first, then safari global allWindowsList, tabIndex, windowIndex set allWindowsList to "" #number of chrome windows in list above set chromeWindowCount to 0 global dbname, block set myurl to item 1 of argv #log "Time since last run in seconds:" & timeSinceLastRun #search chrome, then safari tabs for a string and activate it #windowIndex (current windows being searched) #tabIndex (how far through current window we are) # Inputs: set searchString to "roamresearch.com" set direction to "forward" set lastTargetSearchString to searchString log "Fetching titles from chrome" tell application "Google Chrome" #store windows so we keep the same order #if we don't store them the windows get out of order when we being stuff to front set allWindowsList to windows set allWindowsTabURLList to URL of tabs of every window set allWindowsTabTitlesList to title of tabs of every window end tell set chromeWindowCount to length of allWindowsList log "Fetching titles from safari" tell application "Safari" #store windows so we keep the same order #if we don't store them the windows get out of order when we being stuff to front set allWindowsList to allWindowsList & windows set allWindowsTabURLList to allWindowsTabURLList & (URL of tabs of every window) set allWindowsTabTitlesList to allWindowsTabTitlesList & (name of tabs of every window) end tell set windowIndex to 1 set tabIndex to 0 #log "tabIndex start: " & tabIndex #TODO do we need this? set found to false log "Total windows: " & length of allWindowsList log "Chrome windows: " & chromeWindowCount #stop looping when we get back to where we started, to handle cast where no tabs found set startWindowIndex to windowIndex if direction = "forward" then set tabIndex to tabIndex + 1 else set tabIndex to tabIndex - 1 end if set windowsSearched to 0 #iterate through all windows repeat while windowIndex ≤ length of allWindowsTabURLList and windowIndex > 0 #log "WindowIndex: " & windowIndex #log "tabIndex: " & tabIndex set thisWindowsTabsURLs to item windowIndex of allWindowsTabURLList set thisWindowsTabsTitles to item windowIndex of allWindowsTabTitlesList #log thisWindowsTabsURLs #iterate through all tabs in each window repeat while tabIndex ≤ length of thisWindowsTabsURLs and tabIndex > 0 #log "tabIndex : " & tabIndex set TabURL to item tabIndex of thisWindowsTabsURLs set Tabtitle to item tabIndex of thisWindowsTabsTitles if ((TabURL as text) contains searchString) or (Tabtitle contains searchString) then #chrome windows are first in array if windowIndex ≤ chromeWindowCount then tell application "Google Chrome" activate set w to item windowIndex of allWindowsList set index of w to 1 tell w to set active tab index to tabIndex # log myurl #set myurl to "https://roamresearch.com/#/app/" & dbname & "/page/" & arg tell w to set URL of active tab to myurl end tell #this delay seems to be needed to remove timing voodo delay 0.1 tell application "System Events" tell application process "Google Chrome" tell window 1 perform action "AXRaise" end tell end tell end tell else tell application "Safari" activate set w to item windowIndex of allWindowsList set index of w to 1 tell w to set current tab to tab tabIndex set URL of document 1 to myurl end tell #this delay seems to be needed to remove timing voodo delay 0.1 tell application "System Events" tell application process "Safari" tell window 1 perform action "AXRaise" end tell end tell end tell end if set found to true exit repeat end if #TODO Backward if (direction = "forward") then set tabIndex to tabIndex + 1 else set tabIndex to tabIndex - 1 end if end repeat if found then exit repeat if (direction = "forward") then set tabIndex to 1 set windowIndex to windowIndex + 1 if windowIndex > length of allWindowsTabURLList then set windowIndex to 1 end if else set windowIndex to windowIndex - 1 if windowIndex < 1 then set windowIndex to length of allWindowsTabURLList end if set tabIndex to length of item windowIndex of allWindowsTabURLList end if set windowsSearched to windowsSearched + 1 if windowsSearched > length of allWindowsList then exit repeat end if end repeat if not found then log "not found" end if return found end run script GetTick --> for more precise timer calculations use framework "Foundation" on Now() return (current application's NSDate's timeIntervalSinceReferenceDate) as real end Now end script

on run argv #@osa-lang:AppleScript #Roam Reuse 1.0 # # #current window being scanned set dbname to (system attribute "DBName") if (dbname is "") then display dialog "Please set DBName in workflow environment variables" return end if set windowIndex to 1 #current tab being scanned set tabIndex to 0 set lastTargetSearchString to "" #list of list of tab urls from all windows set allWindowsTabURLList to "" #list of list of tab titles from all windows set allWindowsTabTitlesList to "" #list of all windows, chrome first, then safari global allWindowsList, tabIndex, windowIndex set allWindowsList to "" #number of chrome windows in list above set chromeWindowCount to 0 global dbname, block set myurl to item 1 of argv #log "Time since last run in seconds:" & timeSinceLastRun #search chrome, then safari tabs for a string and activate it #windowIndex (current windows being searched) #tabIndex (how far through current window we are) # Inputs: set searchString to "roamresearch.com" set direction to "forward" set lastTargetSearchString to searchString log "Fetching titles from chrome" tell application "Google Chrome" #store windows so we keep the same order #if we don't store them the windows get out of order when we being stuff to front set allWindowsList to windows set allWindowsTabURLList to URL of tabs of every window set allWindowsTabTitlesList to title of tabs of every window end tell set chromeWindowCount to length of allWindowsList log "Fetching titles from safari" tell application "Safari" #store windows so we keep the same order #if we don't store them the windows get out of order when we being stuff to front set allWindowsList to allWindowsList & windows set allWindowsTabURLList to allWindowsTabURLList & (URL of tabs of every window) set allWindowsTabTitlesList to allWindowsTabTitlesList & (name of tabs of every window) end tell set windowIndex to 1 set tabIndex to 0 #log "tabIndex start: " & tabIndex #TODO do we need this? set found to false log "Total windows: " & length of allWindowsList log "Chrome windows: " & chromeWindowCount #stop looping when we get back to where we started, to handle cast where no tabs found set startWindowIndex to windowIndex if direction = "forward" then set tabIndex to tabIndex + 1 else set tabIndex to tabIndex - 1 end if set windowsSearched to 0 #iterate through all windows repeat while windowIndex ≤ length of allWindowsTabURLList and windowIndex > 0 #log "WindowIndex: " & windowIndex #log "tabIndex: " & tabIndex set thisWindowsTabsURLs to item windowIndex of allWindowsTabURLList set thisWindowsTabsTitles to item windowIndex of allWindowsTabTitlesList #log thisWindowsTabsURLs #iterate through all tabs in each window repeat while tabIndex ≤ length of thisWindowsTabsURLs and tabIndex > 0 #log "tabIndex : " & tabIndex set TabURL to item tabIndex of thisWindowsTabsURLs set Tabtitle to item tabIndex of thisWindowsTabsTitles if ((TabURL as text) contains searchString) or (Tabtitle contains searchString) then #chrome windows are first in array if windowIndex ≤ chromeWindowCount then tell application "Google Chrome" activate set w to item windowIndex of allWindowsList set index of w to 1 tell w to set active tab index to tabIndex # log myurl #set myurl to "https://roamresearch.com/#/app/" & dbname & "/page/" & arg tell w to set URL of active tab to myurl end tell #this delay seems to be needed to remove timing voodo delay 0.1 tell application "System Events" tell application process "Google Chrome" tell window 1 perform action "AXRaise" end tell end tell end tell else tell application "Safari" activate set w to item windowIndex of allWindowsList set index of w to 1 tell w to set current tab to tab tabIndex set URL of document 1 to myurl end tell #this delay seems to be needed to remove timing voodo delay 0.1 tell application "System Events" tell application process "Safari" tell window 1 perform action "AXRaise" end tell end tell end tell end if set found to true exit repeat end if #TODO Backward if (direction = "forward") then set tabIndex to tabIndex + 1 else set tabIndex to tabIndex - 1 end if end repeat if found then exit repeat if (direction = "forward") then set tabIndex to 1 set windowIndex to windowIndex + 1 if windowIndex > length of allWindowsTabURLList then set windowIndex to 1 end if else set windowIndex to windowIndex - 1 if windowIndex < 1 then set windowIndex to length of allWindowsTabURLList end if set tabIndex to length of item windowIndex of allWindowsTabURLList end if set windowsSearched to windowsSearched + 1 if windowsSearched > length of allWindowsList then exit repeat end if end repeat if not found then log "not found" end if return found end run script GetTick --> for more precise timer calculations use framework "Foundation" on Now() return (current application's NSDate's timeIntervalSinceReferenceDate) as real end Now end script

on alfred_script(q) #from here #https://gist.github.com/vitorgalvao/5392178#file-get_title_and_url-applescript
tell application "System Events" to set frontApp to name of first process whose frontmost is true if (frontApp starts with "Google Chrome") or (frontApp starts with "Chromium") or (frontApp starts with "Opera") or (frontApp starts with "Vivaldi") or (frontApp starts with "Brave Browser") or (frontApp starts with "Microsoft Edge") then using terms from application "Google Chrome" tell application frontApp to set currentTabTitle to title of active tab of front window tell application frontApp to set currentTabUrl to URL of active tab of front window end using terms from else if (frontApp starts with "Safari") or (frontApp starts with "Webkit") then using terms from application "Safari" tell application frontApp to set currentTabTitle to name of front document tell application frontApp to set currentTabUrl to URL of front document end using terms from else display dialog "You need a supported browser as your frontmost app" end if set the clipboard to "[" & currentTabTitle & "](" & currentTabUrl & ")" end alfred_script

on run argv #@osa-lang:AppleScript #Roam Reuse 1.0 # # #current window being scanned set dbname to (system attribute "DBName") if (dbname is "") then display dialog "Please set DBName in workflow environment variables" return end if set windowIndex to 1 #current tab being scanned set tabIndex to 0 set lastTargetSearchString to "" #list of list of tab urls from all windows set allWindowsTabURLList to "" #list of list of tab titles from all windows set allWindowsTabTitlesList to "" #list of all windows, chrome first, then safari global allWindowsList, tabIndex, windowIndex set allWindowsList to "" #number of chrome windows in list above set chromeWindowCount to 0 global dbname, block set myurl to item 1 of argv #log "Time since last run in seconds:" & timeSinceLastRun #search chrome, then safari tabs for a string and activate it #windowIndex (current windows being searched) #tabIndex (how far through current window we are) # Inputs: set searchString to "roamresearch.com" set direction to "forward" set lastTargetSearchString to searchString log "Fetching titles from chrome" tell application "Google Chrome" #store windows so we keep the same order #if we don't store them the windows get out of order when we being stuff to front set allWindowsList to windows set allWindowsTabURLList to URL of tabs of every window set allWindowsTabTitlesList to title of tabs of every window end tell set chromeWindowCount to length of allWindowsList log "Fetching titles from safari" tell application "Safari" #store windows so we keep the same order #if we don't store them the windows get out of order when we being stuff to front set allWindowsList to allWindowsList & windows set allWindowsTabURLList to allWindowsTabURLList & (URL of tabs of every window) set allWindowsTabTitlesList to allWindowsTabTitlesList & (name of tabs of every window) end tell set windowIndex to 1 set tabIndex to 0 #log "tabIndex start: " & tabIndex #TODO do we need this? set found to false log "Total windows: " & length of allWindowsList log "Chrome windows: " & chromeWindowCount #stop looping when we get back to where we started, to handle cast where no tabs found set startWindowIndex to windowIndex if direction = "forward" then set tabIndex to tabIndex + 1 else set tabIndex to tabIndex - 1 end if set windowsSearched to 0 #iterate through all windows repeat while windowIndex ≤ length of allWindowsTabURLList and windowIndex > 0 #log "WindowIndex: " & windowIndex #log "tabIndex: " & tabIndex set thisWindowsTabsURLs to item windowIndex of allWindowsTabURLList set thisWindowsTabsTitles to item windowIndex of allWindowsTabTitlesList #log thisWindowsTabsURLs #iterate through all tabs in each window repeat while tabIndex ≤ length of thisWindowsTabsURLs and tabIndex > 0 #log "tabIndex : " & tabIndex set TabURL to item tabIndex of thisWindowsTabsURLs set Tabtitle to item tabIndex of thisWindowsTabsTitles if ((TabURL as text) contains searchString) or (Tabtitle contains searchString) then #chrome windows are first in array if windowIndex ≤ chromeWindowCount then tell application "Google Chrome" activate set w to item windowIndex of allWindowsList set index of w to 1 tell w to set active tab index to tabIndex # log myurl #set myurl to "https://roamresearch.com/#/app/" & dbname & "/page/" & arg tell w to set URL of active tab to myurl end tell #this delay seems to be needed to remove timing voodo delay 0.1 tell application "System Events" tell application process "Google Chrome" tell window 1 perform action "AXRaise" end tell end tell end tell else tell application "Safari" activate set w to item windowIndex of allWindowsList set index of w to 1 tell w to set current tab to tab tabIndex set URL of document 1 to myurl end tell #this delay seems to be needed to remove timing voodo delay 0.1 tell application "System Events" tell application process "Safari" tell window 1 perform action "AXRaise" end tell end tell end tell end if set found to true exit repeat end if #TODO Backward if (direction = "forward") then set tabIndex to tabIndex + 1 else set tabIndex to tabIndex - 1 end if end repeat if found then exit repeat if (direction = "forward") then set tabIndex to 1 set windowIndex to windowIndex + 1 if windowIndex > length of allWindowsTabURLList then set windowIndex to 1 end if else set windowIndex to windowIndex - 1 if windowIndex < 1 then set windowIndex to length of allWindowsTabURLList end if set tabIndex to length of item windowIndex of allWindowsTabURLList end if set windowsSearched to windowsSearched + 1 if windowsSearched > length of allWindowsList then exit repeat end if end repeat if not found then log "not found" end if return found end run script GetTick --> for more precise timer calculations use framework "Foundation" on Now() return (current application's NSDate's timeIntervalSinceReferenceDate) as real end Now end script
on alfred_script(q) tell application "Hook" set bm to bookmark from active window set the clipboard to "[" & title of bm & "](" & address of bm & ")" end tell end alfred_script
Needs RoamSearchConfig page in to target
Choose a block on daily page to jump to

External trigger to load dynamic list of favorite pages from config page. These will be displayed in the menu, and the selected page will be jumped to. Input is an arg containing contents of a block on config page use as base for menu. Each child block is expected to contain a reference to one and only one page.
set target tag to "todos", todo to true, paste to true, and addtimestamp to true

Target this external target from your own alfred workflow to jump to a roam block on the daily page.
Pass (as argument) the string contents of the block on daily page you want to jump to
Pass vars as follows paste : "true" if you want to paste
Load config page "RoamSearchConfig", find block whose name matched the block passed, and return sublocks as menu items that can then be jumped to or pasted under on daily page
Clear query, but stash result in variable
Ask user to select a block from dynamically generated config page. Script will the jump to this block on dialy page, creating it if it does not exist
TODO EXAMPLE Example that grabs selection and sends to tag under roam daily page, as a TODO
set paste to true set addtimestamp to true add todo to true
Go to tag under daily note. Create tag if not present. Do not paste text
BOOKMARK EXAMPLE Example of one key bookmarking- grabs url of current browser tab and sends to tag under daily page. Hook is better :)
GO TO NAMED PAGE EXAMPLE In this case go to page named "Roam"

DYNAMIC FAVORITE EXAMPLE Example showing list of favorite pages with dynamic configuration, driven out of roam.
Passes "Favourite Pages" as arg. Options show in menu are children of "Favourite pages" block on "RoamResearchConfig" page
Ask user to select a block from dynamically generated config page. Script will the jump to this block on dialy page, creating it if it does not exist

External trigger to load dynamic config menu from Roam. Expects the contents of a block on the config page to be passed in the arg. Children of this block will then be shown in the menu. The selected block will be jumped to on daily page (added if not present), with optional paste, todo, timestamp etc.
Load config page "RoamSearchConfig", find block whose name matched the block passed, and return sublocks as page names that can be jumped to
grabs a sceenshot and puts into clipboard. Alfred needs screen recording permissions
set paste to true, and set target tag on daily page
Example of using a keyword to jump straight to a page
Ask user to select a block from dynamically generated config page. Script will the jump to this block on dialy page, creating it if it does not exist
Get url and title of front chrome or safari windows as markdown in clipboard
Load config page "RoamSearchConfig", find block whose name matched the block passed, and return sublocks as page names that can be jumped to
Ask user to select a block from dynamically generated config page. Script will the jump to this block on dialy page, creating it if it does not exist

Filter page names dynamically, emit page id
Can be run by keyword "roam" or by hotkey
Jump to a named page within roam. Expects on argument to be passed, which is the name of the page
Clear query, but stash result in variable
Go to named page with hotkey- pass named page as arg

JUMP TO DAILY TAG EXAMPLE Example showing jumping to tag on daily page with dynamic configuration, driven out of roam.
Passes "Quick Capture Categories" as arg
Clear query, but stash result in variable
Get url and title of front chrome or safari windows as markdown
HOOK EXAMPLE Example using Hook to grab markdown link to documents, files, etc, and sending to a named tag in Roam

Go to daily page.
I set this to ⇧⌘D same as Roam
Load config page "RoamSearchConfig", find block whose name matched the block passed, and return sublocks as page names that can be jumped to
set paste to true, and set target tag on daily page
Go to named page with hotkey- pass named page as arg
GRAB SCREENSHOT EXAMPLE Example that grabs screenshot, and prompts for where to paste it based on dynamic config in Roam. Note that this hotkey sends name of menu node as an arg
Clear query, but stash result in variable
